meanings.definition: A person who has the power to decide or judge something.
meanings.sent1: The arbiters at the competition carefully evaluated each performance.
meanings.sent2: The company hired professional arbiters to resolve the disagreement.
meanings.sent3: The arbiters couldn't agree on the best movie, so they decided to watch both.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, designers are the ultimate arbiters of style.
meanings.sent5: The arbiters' verdict was final and accepted by all parties involved.

meanings.definition: A person or group that has the authority to settle a dispute or make a decision.
meanings.sent1: The arbiters of the game made a fair call that everyone respected.
meanings.sent2: The board of directors acted as the arbiters in the negotiation process.
meanings.sent3: The arbiters of the cooking contest had a tough job tasting all the delicious dishes.
meanings.sent4: In the ancient kingdom, the king's advisors were the arbiters of law and order.
meanings.sent5: The arbiters' decision brought an end to the long-standing argument.
